content.question: Students are instructed to build the circuit shown below. The students want to open and close various switches in the circuit so that the power dissipated in bulb <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is at a maximum. Which combination of open and closed switches should they use?

choices.label: Switch <math alttext="S sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is open, and switches <math alttext="S sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are closed.

Switch <math alttext="S sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are open, and switch <math alttext="S sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is closed.

Switches <math alttext="S sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are open, and switch <math alttext="S sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is closed.

Switches <math alttext="S sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are open, and switch <math alttext="S sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is closed.

Switches <math alttext="S sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="S sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="S sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are closed.

content.answer: Switches <math alttext="S sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="S sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="S sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are closed.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
